title: Types of Mathematical Infinity
topic_summary: Explore the concept of infinity in mathematics, covering countable and uncountable infinities, cardinal and ordinal numbers, and key theorems and paradoxes.
target_audience: Mathematics students, enthusiasts, and anyone interested in foundational concepts of set theory and infinity.

scenes.title: Introduction to Infinity
scenes.narration_summary: Hook with the intuitive idea of infinity and its philosophical roots

scenes.title: Countable Infinity
scenes.narration_summary: Explain countable sets using natural numbers as an example
risk_flags: Requires careful animation timing for set visualization

scenes.title: Uncountable Infinity
scenes.narration_summary: Introduce uncountable sets with real numbers and diagonalization
risk_flags: Diagonalization animation may be complex to implement clearly

scenes.title: Cardinal Numbers
scenes.narration_summary: Discuss cardinal infinities like aleph-0, aleph-1, and the continuum hypothesis

scenes.title: Ordinal Infinities
scenes.narration_summary: Explain ordinal numbers and well-ordering beyond cardinals
risk_flags: Abstract concepts may be hard to visualize

scenes.title: Paradoxes and Applications
scenes.narration_summary: Cover Hilbert's hotel and real-world applications of infinity

scenes.title: Conclusion and Recap
scenes.narration_summary: Summarize key types of infinity and their significance
